name: Environmental impact of inhalers - average carbon footprint per salbutamol inhaler
description: Mean carbon impact (kg CO<sub>2</sub>e) per salbutamol inhaler prescribed
why_it_matters: committed to reducing its carbon footprint by 80% by 2028 to 2032, including a shift to lower carbon inhalers.
Salbutamol metered dose inhalers (MDIs) are the single biggest source of carbon emissions from NHS medicines prescribing.
The 2022-2023 PCN Investment and Impact Fund (IIF) therefore
includes an indicator focusing on mean carbon emissions per salbutamol inhaler prescribed (kg CO2e).
The aim is to encourage prescribing of salbutamol products associated with lower carbon emissions, resulting in a significant reduction in NHS carbon emissions.
Data on carbon emissions per salbutamol inhaler can be viewed in the
numerator_columns:
SUM(

WHEN bnf_code = '0301011R0AABUBU' THEN quantity * 11.79 --Salbutamol CFC free breath actuated inhaler 100 micrograms

WHEN bnf_code = '0301011R0AABZBZ' THEN quantity * 0.62 --Salbutamol 100micrograms/dose dry powder inhaler derived from Easyhaler Salbutamol
